SENTENCE.STRING: (born May 27, 1931) is the Ronald Reagan professor of public policy at Pepperdine University in California, and a professor emeritus at UCLA.
was a professor of government at Harvard University.
has a Ph.D. (1959) and masters degree (1957) from the University of Chicago and an undergraduate degree from the University of Redlands (1952).

is a former Chairman of the White House Task Force on Crime (1966), of the National Advisor Commission on Drug Abuse Prevention (1972-73) and a member of the Attorney General's Task Force on Violent Crime (1981), the President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board (1985-90), and the President's Council on Bioethics.
is a former president of the American Political Science Association.
has served on the board of directors for the New England Electric System, Protection One, RAND, and State Farm Mutual Insurance.
is the chairman of the Council of Academic Advisors of the American Enterprise Institute.
is a member of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences and the American Philosophical Society.
was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by President George W. Bush in 2003.
